frontmatter.author: Edward Snowden
frontmatter.title: [W]e should always make a distinction that right and wrong is a very different standard than legal and illegal.  The law is no substitute for morality.

frontmatter.author: Edward Snowden
frontmatter.title: Laws were broken, and that's because the laws were wrong.

frontmatter.author: Saint Augustine of Hippo
frontmatter.title: An unjust law is no law at all

frontmatter.author: Martin Luther King, Junior
frontmatter.title: One has not only a legal but a moral responsibility to obey just laws.  Conversely one has a moral responsibility to disobey unjust laws.

frontmatter.author: Martin Luther King, Junior
frontmatter.title: [A]n individual who breaks a law that conscience tells him is unjust, and who willingly accepts the penalty of imprisonment in order to arouse the conscience of the community over its injustice, is in reality expressing the highest respect for law.
